p: JEV infection of human microglial cells has been shown to induce an innate immune response characterized by the production of IFN- β via IRF-3 activation and phosphorylation. The overexpression of the ubiquitin ligase TRIM21, which interacts with IRF-3 negatively, regulated this innate immune response by targeting IRF-3-mediated IFN- β production [ 260]. Recently, neuronal transcriptomic responses to JEV infection showed the upregulation of RIG-I and MDA5, suggesting that neuronal cells play a significant role in immunity against JEV [ 261].
